text: Responsible Office: OCIO/ Deputy CIO for Information Technology Security
label: BODY

text: NASA requirements for protecting the security of NASA information and information systems are derived from
label: BODY

text: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) guidance. Information System Owners (ISOs) and other
label: BODY

text: personnel responsible for the protection of NASA information or information systems shall follow NIST guidance in
label: BODY

text: the proper security categorization (Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 199, Standards for Security
label: BODY

text: Categorization for Federal Information and Information Systems), and in the selection and implementation of
label: BODY

text: information security controls (FIPS 200, Minimum Security Requirements for Federal Information and Information
label: BODY

text: Systems and NIST Special Publication (SP) 800-53, Recommended Security Controls for Federal Information Systems
label: BODY

text: and Organizations), in a manner consistent with the Risk Management Framework (NIST SP 800-37, Guide for
label: BODY

text: Applying the Risk Management Framework to Federal Information Systems).
label: BODY

text: This handbook augments NIST guidance by providing NASA-specific requirements, procedures and
label: BODY

text: recommendations, where applicable. NASA-specific guidance does not negate NIST guidance, unless explicitly
label: BODY

text: NASA Policy Directive (NPD) 2810.1, NASA Information Security Policy, NASA Procedural Requirements (NPR)
label: BODY

text: 2810.1, Security of Information Technology, and the collection of 2810 Information Technology Handbooks (ITS­
label: BODY

text: HBK) satisfy the policy and procedure controls of NIST SP 800-53, Recommended Security Controls for Federal
label: BODY

text: NPR 2810.1, Security of Information Technology, designates this handbook as a guide of NASA’s Security
label: BODY

text: Assessment and Authorization (CA) information security controls.
label: BODY

text: The terms “shall” and “may” within this handbook are used as defined in ITS-HBK-0001, Format and Procedures for
label: BODY

text: The Security Assessment and Authorization control family relates to the activities and requirements surrounding
label: BODY

text: the routine testing of security controls, the continuous monitoring of system security posture, and the ongoing
label: BODY

text: risk-based decisions to approve or deny the use of a system. Officials within the NASA community are responsible
label: BODY

text: for continuously ensuring the effectiveness of security control implementations throughout the life cycle of a
label: BODY

text: system. Moreover, in light of an ever-changing security landscape, designated NASA officials should always be
label: BODY

text: prepared to determine the impact of a system’s operation on the success of the NASA mission.
label: BODY

text: The Senior Agency Information Security Officer (SAISO) shall:
label: BODY

text: Ensure the assessment of Agency common controls, and those portions of hybrid controls belonging to the Agency,
label: BODY

text: in a manner consistent with NASA organizationally defined values.
label: BODY

text: Ensure the release of security control assessment details in a manner consistent with NASA organizationally
label: BODY

text: Establish the level of independence necessary (e.g., independent third-party, self-assessment) in order for security
label: BODY

text: control assessments to satisfy Agency requirements.
label: BODY

text: Approve the methods, procedures, and tools employed to assess security controls in the course of standard
label: BODY

text: assessments and as a part of the continuous monitoring process.
label: BODY

text: The Center Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) shall:
label: BODY

text: Conduct reviews and spot checks of Center information systems throughout the assessment process to ensure
label: BODY

text: security controls are documented and meet the minimum security requirements for the system.
label: BODY

text: Ensure timely reporting on the status of security assessments for information systems at their Center.
label: BODY

text: The Organization Computer Security Official (OCSO) shall:
label: BODY

text: Conduct reviews and spot checks of organizational information systems throughout the assessment process to
label: BODY

text: ensure security controls are documented and meet the minimum security requirements for the system.
label: BODY

text: Ensure timely reporting on the status of security assessments for the information systems within their
label: BODY

text: Ensure the assessment of their systems’ security controls in a manner consistent with NASA organizationally
label: BODY

text: Ensure security documentation (e.g., Security Assessment Report (SAR), System Security Plan (SSP)) is updated in
label: BODY

text: the NASA Security Assessment and Authorization Repository (NSAAR), based on security assessments.
label: BODY

text: Ensure that all methods and procedures used in the assessment of security controls have the concurrence of the
label: BODY

text: Make results from security control assessments available to the AO or a designated representative as a part of the
label: BODY

text: The NASA Chief Information Officer (CIO) shall:
label: BODY

text: Approve information system interconnections when the involved information system does not have a valid
label: BODY

text: Approve information system interconnection agreements when the involved system(s) has a valid ATO, as a part of
label: BODY

text: the approval process for authorization packages.
label: BODY

text: Ensure a Memorandum of Understanding/Agreement (MOU/A), and Interconnection Security Agreement (ISA),
label: BODY

text: and System Interconnection Implementation Plan (SIIP) is established prior to the interconnection of NASA
label: BODY

text: Ensure an ATO is available for external information systems prior to their interconnection with NASA systems.
label: BODY

text: Develop, coordinate, and obtain required approvals for information system interconnections.
label: BODY

text: Ensure each connection between information systems is addressed individually in any related documentation.
label: BODY

text: Ensure that for each information system interconnection details regarding interface characteristics, security
label: BODY

text: requirements, and the nature of the information being shared is documented.
label: BODY

text: Ensure the terms and conditions of interconnection agreements are continuously monitored.
label: BODY

text: Appoint principal points of contact for Agency-level Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) items.
label: BODY

text: Provide oversight of Agency-level POA&M items.
label: BODY

text: Appoint principal points of contact for Center-level POA&M items.
label: BODY

text: Provide oversight of Center-level POA&M items.
label: BODY

text: Ensure timely reporting on the status of POA&M items for information systems at their Center.
label: BODY

text: Appoint principal points of contact for POA&M items applicable to their organization.
label: BODY

text: Provide oversight of POA&M items applicable to their organization.
label: BODY

text: Ensure timely reporting on the status of POA&M items for information systems at their organization.
label: BODY

text: Ensure all POA&M items are traceable to their points of discovery.
label: BODY

text: Ensure POA&M items are documented and updated in NSAAR.
label: BODY

text: Ensure POA&M items detail the following information:
label: BODY

text: Descriptions of the observed deficiencies or weaknesses;
label: BODY

text: Associated risk level (High, Moderate, or Low);
label: BODY

text: The office/organization responsible for the items resolution or remediation;
label: BODY

text: Estimated funding/resources required to resolve or remediate the item;
label: BODY

text: Key milestones including completion dates and activities towards the resolution or remediation of the item; and
label: BODY

text: Changes to key milestones subsequent to their initial documentation (note: milestones should not be deleted or
label: BODY

text: changed directly, rather changes should be documented independently);
label: BODY

text: Report on the status of POA&M items as necessary.
label: BODY

text: Make the details of POA&M items available to the AO or a designated representative as a part of the Authorization
label: BODY

text: Adhere to POA&M item requirements detailed in the Table 1.
label: BODY

label: BODY

label: BODY

text: To meet Agency and FISMA reporting requirements,
label: BODY

text: Maintain an awareness of the security posture of information systems under their authority.
label: BODY

text: Review authorization packages for compliance with all applicable requirements.
label: BODY

text: Review authorization packages for compliance with all applicable requirements.
label: BODY

text: Ensure information systems have been granted an authorization to operate prior to their operation.
label: BODY

text: Ensure information systems are reauthorized in a manner consistent with NASA organizationally defined values.
label: BODY

text: Ensure authorization package documentation is updated in NSAAR, based on security authorizations.
label: BODY

text: Ensure authorization packages contain, at a minimum, the following:
label: BODY

text: An authorization letter that includes the time period for which the ATO is effective.
label: BODY

text: The letter may also include specific restrictions, conditions, and/or timelines for the ATO.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: The following table provides the values defined in NIST SP 800-53 as being at the discretion of the implementing organization. The Section, and Parameter columns are intended
label: BODY

text: to help navigate various NIST SP 800-53 security controls for easier application of the organizationally defined values; these columns are defined as follows:
label: BODY

text: Section: Values in this column indicate whether an organizationally defined value is in the main body of the control (Main), or part of one of the control’s enhancements
label: BODY

text: Parameter: Sometimes, a specific Section may have multiple organizationally defined values. In those instances, the bracketed number Parameters indicate which
label: BODY

text: organizationally defined value (numbered sequentially) is being referenced. In the case of nested organizationally defined values, a series of bracketed numbers is
label: BODY

text: Review of controls for need, and
label: BODY

text: Style of release for security control
label: BODY
